results.title: The Role of the Supreme Court
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
Dr David Fellman claims that the U.S. Supreme Court is unique because of its great power. The American system of government is based on the constitution and the Supreme Court is its final judge and arbiter. Dr Fellman discusses the role, organisation, jurisdiction procedures of the supreme court, and explains how it fits in with other U.S. Governmental and civil institutions

results.title: The Role of the Coach
results.creator_credit: Bosisto Productions, South Australian Film Corporation, Bruce Moir and John Dick
results.brief_description: A training film to be used as a discussion starter in the development of new and practising coaches. Emphasises the aims of coaching, the different styles of coaching and individual reasons for involvement.

results.title: The Role of the cell membrane
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Cell”.
Uses close-up photomicrography of a series of amoeba to show the structure and role of the cell membrane, or plasmalemma, as it pertains to “phagocytosis” and “pinocytosis”. Also shows an experiment investigating active transport of sodium ions across live frog skin and discusses possible mechanism for this behaviour. No other credits available.

results.title: The Role of government in the Australian economy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Richard Bluck examines the role of the Australian Government in formulating economic policies. Discusses the Australian Public Sector, the market system, market capitalism, the Great Debate and other recent Australian experiences.

results.title: The Role of government
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Open University and David Jackson
results.brief_description: Legislation is one of the ways by which tight control is kept on environmental matters relating to public health. Looks at the way such legislation arises, how it is drafted within a Government department and the political constraints on its implementation.

results.title: The Rocky horror picture show. - [Collector's ed.]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Michael White and Jim Sharman
results.brief_description: A cult classic, “The Rocky Horror Picture Show” has it all. A musical score by Richard O’Brien, who also stars as the butler Riff Raff, high energy dancing and excellent performances by Barry Bostwick and Susan Sarandon as preppie couple Brad and Janet; Tim Curry as Doctor Frank’n’furter, the ‘Sweet transvestite from transsexual Transylvania’, and a host of others. This collector’s edition celebrates the film’s 21st birthday and includes an hour of extra footage of deleted scenes, outtakes and the Rocky Horror phenomena.

results.title: The Rocky Horror picture show (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Michael White and Jim Sharman
results.brief_description: The film begins with our innocent pair of lovers, Brad and Janet, stranded in a rain storm with the only available shelter being the weird Dr. Frank N. Furter mansion. Before the night is out Brad and Janet will lose their respective virginities to the Doctor, be introduced to his muscle-bound creation, Rocky, and battle the evil beings from the planet Transylvania. The plot is ridiculous, the music enjoyable and the whole thing is an outrageously good time. Possibly the most popular cult movie of all time and based on the original stage musical by Richard O’Brien. With Richard O’Brien, Susan Sarandon, Nell Campbell and Patricia Quinn all doing the “Time warp”. Tim Curry steals the show with an over-the-top performance as the sex mad Doctor.

results.title: The Rocking horse winner
results.creator_credit: Highgate Associates, Learning Corporation of America, William Deneen and Peter Medak
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Classics Dark and Dangerous”.
Adapted from a novel by D.H. Lawrence about a young boy whose rocking horse empowers him to predict winning racehorses at the eventual cost of his life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Rockhoppers
results.creator_credit: Pilgrim Films, Betti Wood and Ossie Emery
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fisherman’s World”.
Ron Calcutt discusses the do’s and dont’s of rock fishing for blackfish along the coast of Australia. He points out the need for special care in this exciting sport due to the unpredictable weather and tidal conditions, which cause many people to lose their lives by drowning.
